snippet: A federal ocean agency released an image that it says suggests that corpses are at the wreckage site, which officials are seeking to protect from salvagers.
abstract: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration releases an image that it says suggests that undiscovered corpses remain at the Titanic wreckage site; federal officials, who have long struggled to assert protective authority over the ship's resting place, say the site is a burial ground and thus should be accorded the respect of such and shielded from looters and artifact hunters; bold federal assertions are dividing Titanic experts, as most experienced divers say they doubt that bodies lie intact within unexplored compartments of the ship.
lead_paragraph: A federal ocean agency released an image that it says suggests that corpses are at the wreckage site, which officials are seeking to protect from salvagers.

headline.seo: Titanic May Hold Passengers’ Remains, Officials Say
headline.main: Experts Split on Possibility of Remains at Titanic Site
headline.print_headline: Experts Split On Possibility Of Remains At Titanic Site
